trans-unit.source: Develop Scalding MapReduce jobs with Maven | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Develop Scalding MapReduce jobs with Maven | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Maven to create a Scalding MapReduce job, then deploy and run the job on a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Maven to create a Scalding MapReduce job, then deploy and run the job on a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Scalding is a Scala library that makes it easy to create Hadoop MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: Scalding is a Scala library that makes it easy to create Hadoop MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: It offers a concise syntax, as well as tight integration with Scala.
trans-unit.target: It offers a concise syntax, as well as tight integration with Scala.

trans-unit.source: In this document, learn how to use Maven to create a basic word count MapReduce job written in Scalding.
trans-unit.target: In this document, learn how to use Maven to create a basic word count MapReduce job written in Scalding.

trans-unit.source: You will then learn how to deploy and run this job on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will then learn how to deploy and run this job on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A Windows or Linux based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Windows or Linux based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Provision Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Provision Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Provision Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Provision Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information.

trans-unit.source: [Maven](http://maven.apache.org/)
trans-unit.target: [Maven](http://maven.apache.org/)

trans-unit.source: [Java platform JDK](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html) 7 or later
trans-unit.target: [Java platform JDK](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html) 7 or later

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new Maven project:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new Maven project:

trans-unit.source: This command will create a new directory named scaldingwordcount, and create the scaffolding for an Scala application.
trans-unit.target: This command will create a new directory named scaldingwordcount, and create the scaffolding for an Scala application.

trans-unit.source: In the scaldingwordcount directory, open the pom.xml file and replace the contents with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the scaldingwordcount directory, open the pom.xml file and replace the contents with the following:

trans-unit.source: This file describes the project, dependencies, and plugins.
trans-unit.target: This file describes the project, dependencies, and plugins.

trans-unit.source: Here are the important entries:
trans-unit.target: Here are the important entries:

trans-unit.source: maven.compiler.source and maven.compiler.target: sets the Java version for this project
trans-unit.target: maven.compiler.source and maven.compiler.target: sets the Java version for this project

trans-unit.source: repositories: the repositories that contain the dependency files used by this project
trans-unit.target: repositories: the repositories that contain the dependency files used by this project

trans-unit.source: scalding-core_2.11 and hadoop-core: this project depends on both Scalding and Hadoop core packages
trans-unit.target: scalding-core_2.11 and hadoop-core: this project depends on both Scalding and Hadoop core packages

trans-unit.source: maven-scala-plugin: plugin to compile scala applications
trans-unit.target: maven-scala-plugin: plugin to compile scala applications

trans-unit.source: maven-shade-plugin: plugin to create shaded (fat) jars.
trans-unit.target: maven-shade-plugin: plugin to create shaded (fat) jars.

trans-unit.source: This plugin applies filters and transformations; specificially:
trans-unit.target: This plugin applies filters and transformations; specificially:

trans-unit.source: filters: The filters applied modify the meta information included with in the jar file.
trans-unit.target: filters: The filters applied modify the meta information included with in the jar file.

trans-unit.source: To prevent signing exceptions at runtime, this excludes various signature files that may be included with dependencies.
trans-unit.target: To prevent signing exceptions at runtime, this excludes various signature files that may be included with dependencies.

trans-unit.source: executions: The package phase execution configuration specifies the com.twitter.scalding.Tool class as the main class for the package.
trans-unit.target: executions: The package phase execution configuration specifies the com.twitter.scalding.Tool class as the main class for the package.

trans-unit.source: Without this, you would need to specify com.twitter.scalding.Tool, as well as the class that contains the application logic, when running the job with the hadoop command.
trans-unit.target: Without this, you would need to specify com.twitter.scalding.Tool, as well as the class that contains the application logic, when running the job with the hadoop command.

trans-unit.source: Delete the src/test directory, as you will not be creating tests with this example.
trans-unit.target: Delete the src/test directory, as you will not be creating tests with this example.

trans-unit.source: Open the src/main/scala/com/microsoft/example/app.scala file and replace the contents with the following:
trans-unit.target: Open the src/main/scala/com/microsoft/example/app.scala file and replace the contents with the following:

trans-unit.source: This implements a basic word count job.
trans-unit.target: This implements a basic word count job.

trans-unit.source: Save and close the files.
trans-unit.target: Save and close the files.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command from the scaldingwordcount directory to build and package the application:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command from the scaldingwordcount directory to build and package the application:

trans-unit.source: Once this job completes, the package containing the WordCount application can be found at target/scaldingwordcount-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.
trans-unit.target: Once this job completes, the package containing the WordCount application can be found at target/scaldingwordcount-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use SSH and the Hadoop command.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use SSH and the Hadoop command.

trans-unit.source: For other methods of running MapReduce jobs, see <linkText>Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For other methods of running MapReduce jobs, see <linkText>Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to upload the package to your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to upload the package to your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: This copies the files from the local system to the head node.
trans-unit.target: This copies the files from the local system to the head node.

trans-unit.source: If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.
trans-unit.target: If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.

trans-unit.source: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the -i parameter and the path to the private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the -i parameter and the path to the private key.

trans-unit.source: For example, scp -i /path/to/private/key target/scaldingwordcount-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar username@clustername-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:.
trans-unit.target: For example, scp -i /path/to/private/key target/scaldingwordcount-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar username@clustername-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to connect to the cluster head node:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to connect to the cluster head node:

trans-unit.source: If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.
trans-unit.target: If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.

trans-unit.source: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the -i parameter and the path to the private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the -i parameter and the path to the private key.

trans-unit.source: For example, ssh -i /path/to/private/key username@clustername-ssh.azurehdinsight.net
trans-unit.target: For example, ssh -i /path/to/private/key username@clustername-ssh.azurehdinsight.net

trans-unit.source: Once connected to the head node, use the following command to run the word cound job
trans-unit.target: Once connected to the head node, use the following command to run the word cound job

trans-unit.source: This runs the WordCount class you implemented earlier.
trans-unit.target: This runs the WordCount class you implemented earlier.

trans-unit.source: --hdfs instructs the job to use HDFS.
trans-unit.target: --hdfs instructs the job to use HDFS.

trans-unit.source: --input specifies the input text file, while --output specifies the output location.
trans-unit.target: --input specifies the input text file, while --output specifies the output location.

trans-unit.target: After the job completes, use the following to view the output.
